thread.title: The legend of the woolly bears lives
thread.title_full: The legend of the woolly bears lives

author: BJ SMALL For the Times
title: The legend of the woolly bears lives
text:
Previous Next YELLOW WOOLLY — 
This yellow woolly bear caterpillar rescued before crossing the highway may be unique for its blond color, but is no better than its fuzzy brown and black brethren, at predicting the severity of the winter.(BJ Small photograph) Posted: Saturday, October 17, 2015 1:26 am The legend of the woolly bears lives BY BJ SMALL For the Times   
Woolly bear caterpillars, those fuzzy, winter weather harbingers entrusted with predicting the severity of winter, are crossing a highway near you. Consider them the Punxsutawney Phil of the fall and just as credible. In actuality, they are no more able to foresee the weather than the groundhog is. 
On the woolly, the greater the middle section of rusty-color fuzz, the longer the winter. The longer the black fuzzed ends of the caterpillar, the longer the winter. Blah. Blah.
